In situations with no ordering interaction, no suggestive selling is expected, so metrics remain at zero.

transcript:
Operator: Welcome to Dairy Queen. How may I help you?
Customer: Hi, I got a mobile order for Jordan Allen.
Operator: Mobile for Jordan?
Customer: Yeah, mobile order for Jordan Allen.
Operator: All right, you can pull forward.
Customer: Thank you.

details.feedback: Operator was courteous but missed revenue opportunities. The Diet Coke had one upsize chance; asking "What size?" is an invalid upsizing phrase and did not steer the guest to the large. No upsell attempts were made, though none were required on the 2 for $5 bundle. A sundae always allows add-ons, yet the operator did not suggest toppings; the guest added them unprompted. Improve by explicitly offering the large size on drinks and proactively suggesting toppings or complementary items.
details.issues: References: 2 For $5 Meal in JSON of Menu Meals (Ordered Items Count 2, Upselling Chance 0, Upsizing Chance 0); Sundae in JSON of Menu Items (Add on Chance Whipped Cream/Nuts/Sprinkles, Upsizing Chance Large Sundae); Upsizing Scenario IO-02 for asking "What size would you like?"; Additional Topping rules under Sundae. Difficulties: Deciding whether the operator’s generic size question counts as an upsize offer—treated as one invalid offer for metrics. Determined no upsell chances because 2 for $5 promotion already chosen. Marshmallow cream treated as customer-initiated topping, not a successful add-on offer.

transcript:
Operator: Welcome to Dairy Queen, how may I help you?
Customer: Let me just look at your menu real quick for a minute.
Customer: All right. I'm going to have the two for five.
Customer: I'm going to have the original cheeseburger and the Diet Coke.
Operator: What size?
Customer: Oh my gosh, what size? I get medium.
Operator: Okay.
Customer: And also, could I have a medium hot fudge sundae?
Operator: Okay.
Customer: Add marshmallow cream and dry nuts.
Operator: Pecans or peanuts?
Customer: Peanuts.
Operator: Anything else?
Customer: No, that's it, thanks.
Operator: All right, it'll be $11.77.
Customer: Okay.

details.feedback: Operator handled the transaction quickly but missed both valid opportunities to recommend extra mix-ins for the two Blizzards. No upsell or upsize chances were available because dessert items are not eligible for combo upsells and the customer specified sizes. Encourage offering extra toppings whenever a Blizzard is ordered to increase average ticket.

Operator: Okay.
Customer: Small chocolate dipped strawberries.
Operator: Anything else?

details.feedback: Operator confirmed dipping sauce quickly but made no upsell or upsize attempts. Missed two upsizing opportunities on the Chicken Strip Basket (offer 6-piece basket, offer large fries) and an add-on opportunity for the Blizzard. Also failed to suggest a drink with the basket. Use VO-13 and VO-04 scripts and Blizzard topping prompts to improve suggestive selling.
details.issues: Upsizing opportunities taken from Upsizing Scenarios VO-13 (Chicken Basket size) and VO-04 (Side size). Additional topping chance sourced from menu JSON entry Blizzard [Sizes: Small, Medium, Large]. Coupon rule (Note about coupons) used to set upselling chances for the basket to 0. Ambiguity: instructions only cancel upselling, not upsizing, when a coupon is used; treated upsizing as still valid.

transcript:
Operator: Welcome to Dairy Queen, how may I help you?
Customer: Hi there, I have a code for a free four-piece chicken strip basket.
Operator: Alright, what was the dipping sauce for that?
Customer: The dipping sauce is going to be barbecue sauce.
Operator: Anything else?
Customer: Can you get me a small, or sorry, the regular size, the second size up from the smallest, just the regular size confetti cake blizzard.
Operator: Okay.
Customer: Yeah, and do you want me to give you the code once I go up there for the free chicken strip?
Operator: Yes.
Customer: Okay, I got you, thank you.
Operator: What was that blizzard, I'm sorry?
Customer: It's going to be a confetti cake, the one that just came out.
Operator: Alright, will that be all?
Customer: Yeah, that's all.
Operator: It'll be $15.57.
Customer: Yeah, I'll be up in a second, thank you.

details.feedback: Operator was polite and efficient but missed suggestive selling. Both the Blizzard and the malt were ordered medium, yet the operator could have asked if the guest wanted to upgrade to large and could have offered extra pumpkin pie topping or extra malt. No upsell or upsize attempts were made, resulting in lost revenue opportunities.

Operator: Welcome to Dairy Queen, how may I help you?
Customer: Can I get a medium pumpkin pie blizzard?

Customer: No, that's it.
Operator: Okay.
Customer: And can I get a medium chocolate malt please?
Operator: Anything else?
Customer: No, that's all.

details.feedback: The operator accurately repeated the final order but made no upsell, upsize, or add-on attempts. Both the shake and Blizzard allow extra mix-ins, yet no offer was presented. With sizes specified there were no valid upsizing chances, but an add-on such as a 2-for-$5 item or another snack could still have been suggested. Ending the call with only the total missed every suggestive-selling best practice.
details.issues: References: Shake & Malt and Blizzard entries in Menu Items JSON for add-on opportunities; Upselling Scenario table (VO-01) to confirm 2-for-$5 scope; Upsizing Scenario table (size already specified leads to Null-02). Pup Cups absent from menu JSON, treated as one-sized item per Scenario Null-01. No matching upsell/upgrade phrases in transcript, so offers recorded as 0. Ambiguities: whether initial cone request was replaced (final confirmation omitted cones, so excluded) and whether pup cups are chargeable; assumed items but with no upsell value. Unclear if shakes count as 'drink' for 2-for-$5; menu JSON distinguishes them, so not counted.

transcript:
Operator: How may I help you today?
Customer: Hi, yes, I would like to get one large chocolate cone, one medium chocolate cone, and two pup cups, please.
Operator: All chocolate ice cream?
Customer: Oh no! Okay, one medium caramel milkshake and one... I will get a mini Reese's peanut butter blizzard treat.
Operator: So you have the medium caramel shake and one mini Reese's peanut butter cup blizzard?
Customer: Yes, and the two pup cups.
Operator: Can you repeat that?
Customer: And the two pup cups.
Operator: Two pup cups?
Customer: Yes.
Operator: And you said two pup cups?
Customer: Yes.
Operator: Is that all for today?
Customer: That's all, thank you.
Operator: Total is $9.40 at the window.
Customer: Thank you.

details.feedback: Operator made one correct upsell attempt by offering to make the cheese dog order a combo, which counts as four offers (two per hot dog) per VO-03 guidelines. Customer declined, so no conversions. No upsizing offers were applicable because the Blizzard was already ordered large and hot dogs have no size variant. Operator missed the valid additional-topping opportunity on the Blizzard. Overall: sound combo upsell attempt, but remember to suggest extra toppings on Blizzards to maximize check size.
details.issues: Upsell scenario sourced from Upselling Scenarios table "Scenario VO-03 – Customer ordered a hotdog, offer combo". Additional-topping chance taken from Menu Items JSON entry for "Blizzard" (Add on Chance: Primary Topping). No upsizing opportunities per Upsizing Scenarios Null-02 (Blizzard already large) and hot dogs lack size options. Ambiguities: transcript contradicts number of cheese dogs (customer said one, later confirmed two); used two based on final customer affirmation. Mapped "cheese dog" to menu item "Chili Cheese Dog" for consistency.

Operator: How may I help you today?
Customer: Hello, let me get a large royal New York cheesecake blizzard, please.
Operator: Is that all for today?
Customer: Yeah, and let me get two cheese dogs.
Operator: Did you say two cheese dogs?
Customer: Just one.
Operator: Do you want to make that a combo?
Customer: No, just one cheese dog.
Operator: So the large royal New York cheesecake blizzard and the two cheese dogs?
Customer: Yep.
Operator: Okay, total is $11.45 at the window.
Customer: All right, thank you.

Operator: How may I help you today?
Customer: Yeah, what time do you close?
Operator: At ten.
Customer: Okay, I'll be there. Thank you.

details.feedback: The operator failed to make a valid upsizing offer. Asking the customer “What size?” (Scenario IO-02) is invalid because it does not specifically suggest the large size. No offer was made to add extra toppings to the Blizzard, missing an additional-topping opportunity. There were no upselling chances on this order. Overall, suggestive selling execution was poor; operator should have offered a large Blizzard and suggested extra mix-ins.
details.issues: Upsizing table Scenario IO-02 (Drink, Chicken Basket, Side, Blizzard, etc.) was referenced for the invalid size question. Menu JSON shows Blizzard has 1 upsize chance to Large and add-on chance of Primary Topping/Ingredient, which established 1 upsize chance and 1 topping chance. No upsell chances exist for Blizzards per menu JSON, setting upsell counts to 0. Ambiguity: Customer said “Small, medium.” before selecting medium; interpreted as choosing medium, not requesting both sizes. No conflicting instructions found.

transcript:
Operator: How may I help you today?
Customer: Can I have a caramel toffee cookie blizzard?
Operator: What size?
Customer: Small, medium.
Operator: A medium caramel toffee cookie blizzard?
Customer: Yeah.
Operator: Is that all for today?
Customer: Yeah, that's it.
Operator: Total is $6.05 at the window.

details.feedback: Operator took order efficiently but missed all suggestive-selling opportunities. One 2-for-5 upsell chance on the small strawberry sundae was ignored, and no attempt was made to add a second qualifying item. Several items (cones, blizzards, sundae, shake) were ordered without largest-size opportunities, yet the operator never offered a large upgrade. Seven separate add-on topping chances (sprinkles, extra malt, whipped cream, double dip, etc.) were also left unaddressed. Overall, call demonstrated polite service but failed to follow Dairy Queen’s required upsell/upsize script, resulting in lost revenue.
details.issues: Upselling chance pulled from Upselling Scenarios table Scenario VO-01 (2for5) and Menu JSON showing Small Sundae qualifies. Upsizing references from Upsizing Scenarios VO-09 (Cone), VO-06 (Blizzard), VO-08 (Sundae), VO-10 (Drink sizes) but none applied because customer specified small. Additional topping chances taken from Menu JSON add-on fields for Cone, Shake, Blizzard, Sundae, Dipped Cone. Difficulties: transcript role labels briefly swapped during Oreo Blizzard sizing dialogue, assumed final size small. ‘Any size drink’ in 2for5 ambiguous for shake; treated shake as not eligible per menu JSON which lists drinks separately. Oreos on side considered customer-initiated topping, not an operator upsell, thus excluded from successes. No conflicting instructions impacted final counts.

transcript:
Operator: Thank you for the DQ topping and what can I get for you?
Customer: Hey, how are you doing today?
Operator: Alright.
Customer: Great. Can I get a small vanilla cone?
Operator: Okay.
Customer: A small caramel milkshake.
Operator: Okay.
Customer: Can I get a small cookie dough blizzard?
Operator: Okay.
Customer: A small Reese's peanut butter cup blizzard?
Operator: Okay.
Customer: A strawberry sundae.
Operator: What's the last one?
Customer: Just a small please.
Operator: Okay.
Customer: Can I get a small chocolate dipped vanilla cone with Oreos on the side?
Operator: Okay.
Customer: Can I please get Oreo blizzard?
Operator: Did you hear that one?
Customer: What size?
Operator: A small please.
Customer: Okay.
Operator: And can, uh, yeah, and that's it.
Operator: Alright, it's going to be $31.50 to have it right now.
Customer: Okay, thank you.

details.feedback: Operator missed two upsizing chances, one for the Blizzard and one for the Dipped Cone. Asking 'What size?' and 'And you said it was a medium?' are clarifying questions, not valid upsizing offers because they do not push the large size. There were also two opportunities to suggest extra mix-ins on the Blizzard or a double-dip or sprinkles on the cone, but no offers were made. No items in the order had upsell chances, so no issue there. Overall, the operator was polite and efficient but did not attempt any suggestive selling.
details.issues: Upsizing chances referenced Scenario VO-06 (Blizzard) and Scenario VO-09 (Cones) from the Upsizing Scenarios table. Add-on chances taken from menu items JSON entries: Blizzard add-on Primary Topping/Ingredient, Dipped Cone add-on Double Dip. No upselling opportunities because both items list 0 upselling chances. Difficulty: interpreting whether customer kept the cone after learning chocolate ice cream unavailable; assumed yes and size medium. Also confirming that clarifying size questions are not considered upsizing offers.

transcript:
Operator: Thank you for the DQ topping and what can I get for you tonight?
Customer: Hey, can I get a caramel toffee cookie blizzard?
Operator: What size?
Customer: Can I get a medium?
Operator: No problem at all, what else can I get for you?
Customer: And then can I get a chocolate dipped cone with chocolate?
Operator: We don't have any chocolate ice cream right now.
Customer: No, it'll work then.

Customer: Thank you, you too.

details.feedback: Operator handled the order politely and accurately but missed two suggestive selling opportunities. Both the Blizzard and the Sundae have add-on topping options that could have been offered to raise check average. Because the customer specified "mini" and "medium" sizes, no valid upsizing opportunities existed, and the items ordered do not qualify for any combo or 2-for-5 upsell. Remember to suggest available add-ons on ice-cream treats whenever the guest orders them.

details.feedback: Operator missed all upsizing and upselling standards. There were three valid upsize chances (fries, drink, burger patty); only the patty was mentioned and phrased as an invalid choice question, so no valid offer or conversion occurred. No large drink or large fry offer was attempted. No effort to add extra Blizzard toppings. Overall, 0/3 upsize conversions, 0 upsell attempts, and poor adherence to suggestive-selling guidelines.

details.feedback: Order accuracy good, but agent missed revenue opportunities. The unsized Royal New York Cheesecake Blizzard created one valid upsizing chance; instead of the required "Would you like that large today?" the agent asked "What size?", an IO-02 invalid offer, so no credit for offering the large size. Agent did not attempt to upsell or upsize the two additional Blizzards or suggest extra mix-ins, leaving three untapped add-on chances. No 2-for-5, combo, or drink–side upsell scenarios applied. To improve, offer the largest size directly and propose extra toppings on every Blizzard ("Would you like extra cheesecake pieces?"), which boosts check average and meets suggestive-selling standards.
details.issues: Menu Items JSON: Blizzard entry (upsizing chance Large Blizzard, add-on primary topping) and Bottled Water entry (no upsize). Upsizing Scenarios: VO-06 (valid), IO-02 (invalid "What size?"). No relevant upsell scenarios matched. Difficulties: determining whether the agent’s size prompt counts as an offer; guidelines state it is an invalid upsizing offer but still considered an offer made, so counted in field 11. Needed to treat bottled water as two separate items for counts and confirm no upsize. No other ambiguities.

details.feedback: No sale was completed. Customer requested a cup of chocolate ice cream, but the item was out of stock and the customer elected to cancel the order. The operator correctly informed the customer of the stock situation but did not attempt to pivot to an in-stock alternative (e.g., vanilla or twist cone, sundae, Blizzard, or shake) and therefore missed any potential upsell or upsize opportunities.
details.issues: Referenced Items JSON: Sundae entries (small/medium/large) as the closest match to a “cup of chocolate ice cream.” Following guideline that out-of-stock items are not listed in ordered items, all counts remain zero. Ambiguity: transcript did not specify exact menu item or size, but since item was unavailable and no replacement was accepted, no further action was required.

details.feedback: Operator accurately confirmed special requests and addressed item availability but missed all suggestive selling opportunities. A strawberry sundae without specified size qualified for a valid upsizing attempt to a large sundae (Scenario VO-08) and a clear path to offer extra toppings like whipped cream or nuts. The order also fit the 2-for-$5 add-on framework, yet no such offer was made. No upsell or upsize language was used, resulting in zero offers and zero conversions.

Operator: Okay.
Customer: And that's it.
Operator: Alright, total is $9.93 at the window.

details.feedback: The transcript contained no details about the customer’s order, so no items, upsell or upsize opportunities could be identified or evaluated.
